cheatsheet.title: Visualising Scientific Data Rendered on Remote Machine

intro.description: This cheat sheet will show you how to invoke a remotely rendered visualisation.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse User perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse User perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Other... and select g-Eclipse (User). Alternatively, click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Locate a VTK Pipeline File
item.description: If you have followed the previous cheatsheets, you will have a .vtkpipeline file somewhere in your project view. Locate this file.

item.title: Open Remote Rendering Viewer
item.description: Note that as of now, full functionality is not implemented and only a demo is available. Right-click on your .vtkpipeline file and select Render Remotely. This will bring up a GVid viewer.

item.title: Invoke Remote Rendering Demo
item.description: Click on the New Connection button in the upper right corner of the GVid view. In the wizard that pops up, select GLogin connection and click Next. On the next page of the wizard, enter the following settings:

subitem.label: Leave everything else blank and unselected and click Finish.
